CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 12, 1952, pg. 34 reads: "New Electives Take Office - Two of the most controversial candidates but winners in the Nov. 6 elections attracted enormous crowds to the court house on Jan. 4 and 7. District Attorney James F. Malone Jr. took the oath of office Jan. 4 and State Senator John M. Walker was sworn in Jan. 7 as a minority member of the Board of County Commissioners.  Both are Republicans.  In the top photo is shown a contingent of Negro Republican leaders and voters, including David Thompkin, chairman of the Fifth Ward...Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait Republican leaders and voters, with seven men, including David Thompkin, and eleven women, including one crouched wearing dark fur warp, posed in Allegheny Courthouse for swearing in ceremonies
